468dae06-bb32-46fa-88b0-788388ad610c.description: Earners have engaged in Digital Skills Week activities delivered by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College, as part of Cities of Learning. The earner acquired information about the 7 key digital skills vital to their studies and future employment through experiencing online and face-to-face sessions. They developed an awareness of Internet safety & security; communicating & collaborating digitally; digital planning & organisation; an introduction to coding and other related activities.
468dae06-bb32-46fa-88b0-788388ad610c.name: GBMET Digital Skills Week - Digital Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College and authorized by Future Creators

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badge Standard - Engage Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Engage Layer of the Cities of Learning Badge Standard. Earners understand what's expected of them and are able to acquire information by actively experiencing learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Attended or experienced Digital Skills Week information sessions either face-to-face at the Digital Roadshow or in tutorial sessions or online via the Student Hub.
Joined the online Digital Skills Week Classroom to gain more information about the 7 key digital skills
Either online or at: Greater Brighton Metropolitan College
This activity is open to all students of Greater Brighton Metropolitan College

dfc692b9-91d7-4bfe-b599-bf69da5ae5e2.description: Earners have participated in a work experience programme delivered by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College, as part of Cities of Learning. The earner deepened their knowledge of work based learning, actively explored transferable skills and met the expectation of professionalism in the workplace. Participated in both independent and group activities, in a series of college based sessions on work experience preparation, skills for life and work and prepared for a successful work experience .
dfc692b9-91d7-4bfe-b599-bf69da5ae5e2.name: GBMET Work Experience Ready

issuer.summary: issued by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College and authorized by Future Creators

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Participation Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participation Layer of the Cities of Learning Spine. Earners meet expectations, can interact with learning and are able to join in with others.

badge_template_activities.title: Participated fully and positively in work experience preparation sessions outlining the value, objectives and requirements of work experience. The earner reflected on their work preparation and carried out a skills assessment to indicate areas for personal development.

The earner has participated in team building activities, building transferable skills such as team work, communication, planning and project management. The earner developed an understanding of workplace skills, beginning to build their own and created personal targets for their placement.
Greater Brighton Metropolitan College 1A Pelham St, Brighton BN1 4FA
This badge is available for GBMET students

387b3e43-d119-4165-a93a-02269b9dce7f.description: The earner has demonstrated their skills in the workplace through successfully completing work experience, organised by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College, as part of Cities of Learning. The individual applied their industry knowledge in a real-world environment and actively utilised their transferable skills, received feedback to develop, and showed consistency in approaches to professionalism in the workplace.
387b3e43-d119-4165-a93a-02269b9dce7f.name: GBMET Work Experience

issuer.summary: issued by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College and authorized by Future Creators

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badge Standard - Demonstrate Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Demonstrate Layer of the Cities of Learning Badge Standard. Earners show consistency in their approach and can apply knowledge with real world context to receive feedback and develop.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner gathered knowledge about the workplace and industry through observation and taking an active role in day to day tasks during work placement/work related activities. Focus placed on personal development targets and employer feedback to help plan next steps and re-evaluate transferable skills via skills assessment.
On placement, the earner completed a placement diary or portfolio of personal reflection and progress in relation to personal targets and submitted a work experience evaluation.
Greater Brighton Metropolitan College, Pelham Street, Brighton BN1 4FA and various employers premises throughout Greater Brighton
This badge is open to GBMET students

5fc2479c-6a55-4c0a-ac60-76417555db58.description: Earners have participated in Digital Induction activities delivered by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College, as part of Cities of Learning. The earner interacted with an online program to learn about getting started with digital tools at college, staying safe online and key apps and tools to support their studies. They were then able to use these digital tools to assess and record their learning as well as access further support and training.
5fc2479c-6a55-4c0a-ac60-76417555db58.name: GBMET Digital Induction - Working in a Digital World

issuer.summary: issued by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College and authorized by Future Creators

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Participation Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participation Layer of the Cities of Learning Spine. Earners meet expectations, can interact with learning and are able to join in with others.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner has completed a number of self-directed learning activities online covering a range of topics to prepare for working digitally at college and beyond. Including: - Getting Started at College - Staying Safe Online - An Introduction to Digital Tools for Study
The earner has achieved 80% or above in the two GBMET Digital Induction self assessments
This activity takes place online or at Greater Brighton Metropolitan College
This activity is open to all students of Greater Brighton Metropolitan College

584dceec-e93c-4312-9bdf-a6675d16985e.description: Earners have participated in Digital Skills Week activities delivered by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College, as part of Cities of Learning. The earner interacted with online and face-to-face activities to build skills in: Internet safety & security; communicating & collaborating digitally; digital planning & organisation; creating a positive digital footprint; research, referencing & copyright; basic design skills; and an introduction to coding.
584dceec-e93c-4312-9bdf-a6675d16985e.name: GBMET Digital Skills Week - Digital Citizen

issuer.summary: issued by Greater Brighton Metropolitan College and authorized by Future Creators

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Spine - Participation Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participation Layer of the Cities of Learning Spine. Earners meet expectations, can interact with learning and are able to join in with others.

badge_template_activities.title: Participated in one or more activities or short online courses on the online Digital Skills Week Classroom and submitted evidence of this participation

Completed at least one of the following activities and submitted evidence of participation in the Digital Skills Week Classroom: GBMET Online Safety Module, Cyberbullying, Digital Escape Room, Present Your Ideas for Classroom Expectations, Create a Study Schedule to Meet Your Goals, Lessons Understand Your Digital Footprint Lessons, Graphic Design Basics - Design School Understand the basics of code, Courses - Google Digital Garage, Copyright and copying at College, Research Activity 1 & 2
Either online or at Greater Brighton Metropolitan College Greater Brighton Metropolitan College 1A Pelham St, Brighton BN1 4FA
This activity is open to all students of Greater Brighton Metropolitan College
